subject: [Lab 04] Q1: Skip Add
content:
Q1: Skip Add

Please post all questions you have below concerning Q1: Skip Add in the follow-ups.

If you are stuck on this question, feel free to read through the follow-up responses to see if you can draw any ideas from them.

threads.question: I'm getting a FileNotFound Error while trying to run the OKPY check for Q1.                FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: 'lab03.py'  It seems to me that the .ok file is trying to check something in a lab03.py file, even though lab 03 never existed (because of the midterm). Is this just an issue with the name of the files?

follow-ups.feedback: It's possibly a name with the files, let me check
Yep, either redownload in 30m or change the doctest to say lab04.py instead of lab03.py
Manually changing the doctest worked. Thanks.

threads.question: I didn’t use helped function and I take n-2 as the parameter in recursive call, but I keep getting “nonetype + int” error. I don’t see a nonetype though.

![](/redirect/s3?bucket=uploads&prefix=attach%2Fjziyku5gomy7aq%2Fj6wldnh09m0nu%2Fk12l2mbemo8f%2FScreen_Shot_20190927_at_1.32.45_PM.png)  I'm not sure why I'm getting this error. My code works for skip_add(5) and skip_add(10). I also didn't use While or For.

follow-ups.feedback: Please make a private post with your code.

threads.question: Doctests for skip_add >>> from lab04 import * >>> skip_add(5) # 5 + 3 + 1 + 0 9 # Error: expected # but got # 9 I'm getting 9, but the test keeps failing. How do I fix this?

follow-ups.feedback: Maybe you accidentally deleted a line from the doctest? Try looking at a fresh copy of lab04.py and seeing if that's the case
